paper_abstract: For a set M = {-mu, -mu + 1, ..., lambda) \ {0} with nonnegative integers lambda, mu < q not both 0, a subset S of the residue class ring Z(q) modulo an integer q > 1 is called a (lambda, mu; q)-covering set if MS = {ms mod q : m E M, s E 5) = Z(q). Small covering sets play an important role in codes correcting limited-magnitude errors. We give an explicit construction of a (lambda, mu; g)-covering set 5, which is of the size q(1+0(1)) max{lambda, mu)(-1/2) for almost all integers q > 1 and optimal order of magnitude (that is up to a multiplicative constant) p max{lambda, mu}(-1) if q = p is prime. Furthermore, using a bound on the fourth moment of character sums of Cochrane and Shi that there is a (lambda, mu; q)-covering set of size at most 1-F0(1) maxti, 0-112 for any integer q > 1, however the proof of this bound is not constructive.
